resources.string: This app was created as part of Daniela Pavlenco\'s bachelor thesis at the Polytechnic University of Timisoara. It helps you monitor and manage your Android device\'s hardware and software, providing features like CPU, GPU, and memory usage statistics, display settings management, app management, and battery/performance optimization.\n\nIn recent times, many features are being taken away from users with each Android update, leading to less control over devices that they own. This app was made to demonstrate the possibilities even within the current limits, giving users more control over their devices and showing what can still be achieved."

Amidst a time when Google keeps taking away device-related permissions from its users with each Android update, I, the developer decided it was the right time to show the capabilities of device customization and control before that is all inevitably discontinued in future updates. Rooting your device seems to have become the only way to fully utilize most options, and certain features that used to work without root were still implemented in the app and can be used with older phones.
What is the purpose of this app?

This app is designed to help users monitor and manage various aspects of their Android device\'s hardware and software. It provides detailed statistics on CPU, GPU, network and memory usage, allows display settings customization, app management, and offers tools to optimize battery and performance settings.
What phones was this app tested on during development?

This app was mainly tested on an unrooted Samsung Galaxy S23 and an emulated rooted Google Pixel 6 with API Level 33. The rooting was done using RootAVD + Magisk, which we recommend to all users that wish to try out rooted options before trying it on real phones.
Does this app require root access?

Some features of this app require root access to function properly, such as advanced performance tweaks and certain system-level changes. However, many features, like monitoring and basic app management, do not require root access.
The main functionalities of this app are done using commands sent to the runtime of the Android operating system, the terminal is a perfect way to test commands from within the device.

The WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission allows apps to modify secure system settings, such as enabling or disabling features like developer options, changing display settings, and adjusting network configurations. This permission is highly restricted because it can affect the overall behavior and security of the device.
What is ADB and how do I use it?

ADB (Android Debug Bridge) is a versatile command-line tool that allows you to communicate with your Android device from a computer. It facilitates various tasks, such as installing and debugging apps, accessing device logs, and running shell commands. ADB is an essential tool for developers and advanced users who want to manage their devices more effectively.
What is root access and why do I need it?

Root access is the ability to gain administrative privileges on your Android device. With root access, you can modify system files, access restricted areas of the operating system, and perform actions that are not available to regular users. Our app requires root access for advanced features such as performance tweaks, system-level changes, and certain app management functions. Please note that rooting your device can void your warranty and may pose security risks. Ensure you understand the implications before proceeding.
How do I root my device?

Rooting your device involves unlocking the bootloader and installing a custom recovery, followed by flashing a root package (such as Magisk or SuperSU). The process varies between devices, so it\'s essential to follow a detailed guide specific to your device model. Be cautious, as incorrect steps can lead to data loss or bricking your device.

Are you absolutely sure what you\'re doing?
This section allows you to set the CPU governor. The governor controls the CPU\'s frequency scaling and can affect performance and battery life. Choose a governor from the dropdown list.
Optimizes the Wi-Fi scan interval, enables the power saving mode, disables the error reports without performance impacts to improve your battery life.

This option flags the device as a low RAM one, turning off specific memory-intensive features (status bar tinting, notification panel background effect etc) which works poorly on low-memory devices.\n\nIf disabled, you may need to REBOOT to apply the changes.
Waiting interval before entering in deep idle mode
Doze mode reduces battery consumption by deferring background CPU and network activity for apps when the device is unused for long periods of time until maintenance windows
Disables and enables Wi-Fi. Can work without root on older versions of Android
Disables and enables Bluetooth. Can work without root on older versions of Android
This function allows you to enable or disable synchronization for all accounts on the device. Enabling sync ensures that data is kept up to date, while disabling sync can help save battery life.

This function allows you to toggle Dark Mode on and off on your device. Dark Mode reduces the amount of light emitted by your device\'s screen while maintaining the minimum color contrast ratios required for readability. Enabling Dark Mode can help reduce eye strain and save battery life on OLED screens.
Optimizes the touch pressure scale and animations duration for improved user interface elements.
Improves the scrolling responsiveness and speed
Adjusts the minimum number of video frame periods per buffer swap to prevent the \"frame tearing\" (when you see half of one frame and half of another)

Enables the performance tuning mode, decreases the colors number to 16bpp (16 bits per pixel) and optimizes the \"fling\" velocity (smooth scroll) for a general improvement with minimal impact on battery.
Optimizes the screen composition properties and enables overlay UI mode for a better graphics quality.
Enables the hardware accelerated UI, forces GPU screen composing and disables the vsync for a much better performance at the cost of battery.
Reduces the delay to receive or end a call

This function allows you to enable color correction on your device. The available options are: 
- Monochromatic: This mode displays the entire screen in shades of gray. 
- Protanomaly: This mode is designed for individuals with red-green color blindness, specifically affecting red hues. 
- Deuteranomaly: This mode is designed for individuals with red-green color blindness, specifically affecting green hues. 
- Tritanomaly: This mode is designed for individuals with blue-yellow color blindness.

Enabling color correction can help individuals with color vision deficiencies see content more clearly.

This function allows you to enable magnification on your device. Magnification makes it easier to read and view content by enlarging a part of the screen. You can zoom in and out by triple-tapping the screen or using other accessibility gestures. This feature is especially helpful for individuals with low vision, allowing them to better see details on their device\'s display.

The interval in milliseconds to scan as used by the Wi-Fi supplicant.\nDefault: 15000ms.
The interval in milliseconds to issue wake up scans when Wi-Fi needs to connect.\nDefault: 300000ms.
